wikipedia_page.main:
Sir Walter Menzies (24 July 1856 – 26 October 1913) was a Liberal Party politician in Scotland who served as Member of Parliament (MP) for Southern Lanarkshire from 1900 to 1913.
He unsuccessfully contested the Glasgow Central constituency at the 1892 general election.  He switched to the Southern Division of Lanarkshire for the 1900 election, a Conservative-Liberal marginal seat. He lost by 452 votes, but in the Liberal landslide at the 1906 election he won the seat with a majority of 1,275. He was re-elected at both the January 1910 and December 1910 elections, and held his seat in the House of Commons until his death in 1913, aged 57.

link_mentions.page: List of MPs elected in the January 1910 United Kingdom general election

response: Sir Walter Menzies had been Liberal MP for South Lanarkshire  since 1906 until he died on 26 October 1913. He had died after a long illness, so the calling of a by-election was not unexpected.
